preface.title: Preface
preface.para: People, especially managers, like to have facts and figures when taking decisions, either because a lot of money may be involved, or their job (or both). If you want to prove your website (or switch, or basically any other device) was available, showed the proper performance, or just want to know current and past CPU load, you've come to the right place.
UpWatch is scalable, fast, extensible, built on proven opensource tools, and is built not to loose data.

sect1.title: Getting upwatch
sect1.para: Currently, upwatch is not released, and is not allowed to be distributed. The only way to get it, is through written permission of UpWatch BV.
If you aquired that, you will either receive access to CVS, or will receive a tar.gz file, or .RPM's.

sect1.title: Compiling upwatch
sect1.para: Just in case you really want to (or need to) compile upwatch yourself, it's pretty easy:
sect1.literallayout: tar xzvf upwatch-x.x.tar.gz cd upwatch-x.x ./configure make
sect1.para: Nothing to it... In case of problems, you're probably missing some library or header files, or they are in unexpected places. Look in config.log.

sect1.title: Actual Installation
sect1.para: Before you install the software decide on the architecture. If you know in advance yuo'll have to monitor thousands of hosts, or the probes will exhaust your machine otherwise, you may have to split your installation across several machines. There may be more reasons to do that. Consult Scaling up and How it all works
